sentences: Laskis teiste Õpetused ja soovitused ühest kõrvast sisse ja teisest välja.
Koduste hurjutustega on pojapoeg juba harjunud, lähevad kõrvast sisse, teisest välja.
Tühi lora, kõrvast sisse, teisest välja.
context: The word 'teisest' is the elative case (from out of) form of the Estonian word 'teine', which means 'other' or 'second'. In these expressions, it appears in common phrases meaning 'in one ear and out the other' - something that goes in one side but doesn't stay or register. It's used to describe information or advice that is immediately forgotten or ignored.
